intro: Chisocheton kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu chisocheton, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. This plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It is typically found in primary lowland dipterocarp forests at elevations above 800 meters. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
